website_summaries.verdict: This rugged emergency radio is proven to perform in extreme wind, heavy snow, and other inclement weather conditions.
pros: Versatile radio can be charged using a USB cable, solar panel, or hand crank
Portable radio fits perfectly inside a bag or suitcase
Can be used to recharge a smartphone, tablet, or other devices that have a USB port
cons: Antenna sometimes breaks off the radio
May provide only a limited number of AM and FM stations

customer_reviews.title: She says this is the best gift ever
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my sister who lives in Puerto Rico. She doesn't have electricity after the hurricane Maria. She loves it! Not only she is able to listen to the news, and use the light at night, she is also able to charge her phone and connect a small USB fan. She says this is the best gift ever.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Great when the power goes out
customer_reviews.text: Power went out and this thing came in handy. While it has a solar charger and a crank, I suggest charging it with the included usb cable. The Solar Charger works, it just takes a little while to charge. And the crank also works, it just takes some work. This did charge my cell phone for a little while, but did not last long. Good for enough charge for a quick call, but not a long charge.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Trout

customer_reviews.title: Perfect ALL-IN-ONE Emergency Radio
customer_reviews.text: The only emergency radio I buy, they’re great for gifts as well! Can’t beat it for that price: Solar, crank, battery bank built in, am/fm/weather, flashlight. The flashlight isn’t the best, but if you’re in the dark, it’s gonna be fine. No need to carry batteries or other accessories. PERFECT ALL IN ONE for your vehicle, home, edc bag etc
customer_reviews.author: Dakota

customer_reviews.title: Hurricane Kit Necessity - Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: We just weathered Hurricane Harvey in Houston. We lost power for days during the worst of the storm, and this was our main lifeline to weather updates and tornado warnings. It required minimal effort to get started, was easy to work, and reliable. An absolutely necessary item in a hurricane or emergency kit. I'm so grateful we had this.
customer_reviews.author: LeeLee

customer_reviews.title: Handy to have
customer_reviews.text: This is a great gadget for when the power goes out or for the car. On mine, the tuning knob is hard to work, but it does work if you stay with it. Everything else works fine so far as I can tell. I will turn it on and use it monthly for at least a few minutes to keep everything in it moving. (whether that helps or not I have no idea) I also found it handy when walking the dog in the evening what with the flashlight and music, it is more cost efficient than using a phone if it should drop.
customer_reviews.author: nUSA

customer_reviews.title: Handy product, excellent customer service
customer_reviews.text: The first unit I received was a lemon, but the seller was very committed to making things right. The replacement I received works very well. I’m able to get weatherband reception, sound quality is good, the hand crank really works, and the phone charger does, too. I can’t yet attest to durability, but hopefully it’ll keep up the good work! I’m glad to have this handy unit in case of a weather emergency or power outage.
customer_reviews.author: katywat

customer_reviews.title: Great little radio
customer_reviews.text: Great little radio, good sound, easy tuning and fits in your pocket to go everywhere with you. Great flashlight, I haven't tried charging my phone yet however I'm sure that will do great too! I haven't tried the solar charge yet as I live in the Seattle area and it is fall but the weather band will be greatly appreciated.
customer_reviews.author: Janet S Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Compact Take Along
customer_reviews.text: Fun little multi-tasker. I originally bought this for my husband to hear ball games but it proves more useful than that. We had this out on our boat to hear weather reports. Love the fact we can charge a phone from it and use it as a flashlight.
customer_reviews.author: Haleiwa

customer_reviews.title: It's only this big
customer_reviews.text: I know the description has its dimensions, but you really don't realize how small it is until you get it in your hands. I've been using it for a couple of weekends and I have to say it's pretty nice. If you've got sun, it plays all day. I have yet to recharge it. It does have a tinny sound but that is to be expected at this size and price point.
customer_reviews.author: Castaway Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: I need to get two more
customer_reviews.text: Just got it. Weather radio came in clear and loud. Very compact. Wound it up. Bright light. Just what I needed. Lots of bad weather where I live. Power goes out a lot.
customer_reviews.author: D C McKay

customer_reviews.title: Compact and Invaluable for Emergencies
customer_reviews.text: This is the cutest hand-cranked radio I've ever seen. And yeah, I guess that's a weird way to describe a radio. Bought it for camping trips and emergency situations. Works like a charm. The hand-crank can be a bit of a pain to rotate around because the arm is kind of short and my knuckles hit the body of the radio when I do. But this will be invaluable when needed. Compact, light, and I dig the matte red.
customer_reviews.author: Out DorsieTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Powerful little device!
customer_reviews.text: Great value for the money. I’d cranked for 3 minutes, the radio will play for 15 min. It’s a hand workout for someone with tendinitis, but for someone with no hand or joint problems it should be easy. I haven’t tried the solar power or phone charger yet.
customer_reviews.author: PrimeOne

customer_reviews.title: Not a weather alert radio
customer_reviews.text: This radio is ok but be aware that it is NOT a weather ALERT radio which is why I wanted it. All you can do for weather is have it constantly on the weather broadcast station which for Minnesota was state-wide weather reports. Don’t waste your money on this if you want a weather radio. Look for one that specifically has a weather ALERT function.
customer_reviews.author: Kristina

customer_reviews.title: Compact neccessity
customer_reviews.text: Havent used yet but purchased for emergencies. Shocked by how small it is but it has a lot of features. We did try the flashlight, its super bright which was a plus. Easy to crank when he tested it. Love the bright color
customer_reviews.author: Missy2beTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Worked for a little while and then one segment of ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked for a little while and then one segment of the antenna broke off. Continued working with shorter antenna until today when either the charger or the battery failed. Now, it only makes static and that only happens when the crank is turning. And, I've not used this radio much at all. Maybe a total of two hours.
customer_reviews.author: IamMrsOz

customer_reviews.title: Good for day trips
customer_reviews.text: We purchased two, and tested one it did charge my phone and then we read it takes 10-12 hrs in sunlight to recharge. Or you can crank for 4 min to get a charge but that lasts less than a min. In a Emergency situation I don't feel like this is the size I want to trust. But it does come with adapter to recharge using your phone charger or computer which makes it a nice carry on size for a hiking day trip. That is why I am giving it 3 stars. Not 5 for ER power outage because you may have to wait 12 hrs to get it charged up by sun or human cranking.
customer_reviews.author: Live_Love_Laugh

customer_reviews.title: Useless when you need it
customer_reviews.text: Bought this at the beginning of hurricane season to replace a 14 year old Eton crank radio that still worked, but whose plastic had become tacky from age. Glad we kept the old one. This Esky is useless. Cranked until my arm was sore, because you don't have enough sunlight during a storm for the solar to work. The flashlight flickered and went out, but the radio never came on. Not even static! We're in the middle of Hurricane Hermine and need a reliable product, but the Esky is not reliable at all. I would not recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hill

customer_reviews.title: Did not meet my expectations
customer_reviews.text: I returned it. Wouldn't charge properly and after cranking it like crazy the radio still only played for a few minutes. There was no way to plug it in. Charged either by crank or by solar and the solar didn't seem to work
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Horrid...Can't hold a charge
customer_reviews.text: First off, it doesn't hold a charge. You plug it into usb and it just blinks like it is charging, then even if charging for entire day, you unlpug it, it won't turn on. Was happy we had it with Irma approaching, tried to test it only to find out it fails. This is the worst kind of fail when you get some thing for emergencies, then it fails during the emergency. Wouldn't recommend at all!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher A. Moreno

customer_reviews.title: Decent little radio
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent little radio. I bought it as a small radio to keep in my work bag. The flashlight is bright and radio is surprisingly loud for it's size. The radio picked up most stations I tried but would lose some if it was bumped. The solar charger seems to be very slow. Left in sun light for roughly 8-10 hours and it would die in 3 min of radio use. This was what I was hoping to use for the main charging but guess not. The hand crank works as you can guess for being so small but the handle broke on the first day of use.
customer_reviews.author: ChevyTruck

customer_reviews.title: perfect for power outages
customer_reviews.text: when I opened the box seeing how small the emergency radio flashlight was I was sceptical about the good reviews it got but after trying it a couple times then the first power outage I knew the reviews were spot on...sound is good even in high rise living and the flashlight is super bright...I found the battery to last pretty long...I not had it run out...I use solar charging method I far...I always have it near where light is coming in I never fear not having it to use...I have walking issues and have fears when power out so this gives me security...definitely get it or yourself and loved ones...it a great product
customer_reviews.author: Jennie

customer_reviews.title: The product was so good, I went back and ordered 3 more
customer_reviews.text: The product was so good, I went back and ordered 3 more, one for each of my grown children, so they could have one in an emergency situation. A few cranks and you're good to go - for a long while. And the light is very bright!! Thanks for a great product!
customer_reviews.author: D. Hauntsman

customer_reviews.title: Powerful and super useful- but only lasted 1 use!
customer_reviews.text: This little radio is AMAZING, used it when we lost power during Hurricane Irma. We charged it before the hurricane and it lasted charged the whole 2 days, we didn't have to hand crank it. The light is super bright, the volume is very loud. I can't believe that such small gadget can pack so much power. LOVED IT *** Update July 2020- Only used radio once and stored it. it never charged again. Radio turns on and off intermittently. It seems that the model was recently upgraded. Contacted Esky, waiting to see if the company provides good customer service.
customer_reviews.author: ElvNat

customer_reviews.title: Quite surprised...in a good way!
customer_reviews.text: I must say, I'm rather impressed. Not hard plastic, almost feels soft, like suede. Not much bigger than my phone, although thicker. All functions work as described. I have charged it all 3 ways with no problems. I have charged my phone and mp3 player, also with no issues. The flashlight works fine. Not super bright, but I didn't buy it as a flashlight. The radio works great. Plenty loud enough, without a bunch of distortion. Its going in my get home bag in my van. Probably going to wind up buying a couple more for my and my wife's b.o.b.'s. If ya don't buy it expecting a hundred dollar radio, you'll be more than satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: zathrus

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, poor performance...
customer_reviews.text: I've had this radio for a few months and I generally use it to catch up on the overnight news first thing in the morning. This radio started out spectacularly. It's made from good materials, the sound is fine, but after about three months, I found myself having to rewind it after about three minutes of play. That's not good. I generally only listen for about 15-20 minutes a day, but now I find myself winding up the system every morning after only a short time. What a disappointment, I was really looking forward to not having to buy one operating on batteries, that's why I bought this one. Too bad it's underperforming.
customer_reviews.author: Quixote010

customer_reviews.title: Flashlights works
customer_reviews.text: I got this to use as a flashlight and in case of emergency for lost of power. As a flashlight it is perfect. The radio is also good. However I recently lost power and went to get it to make sure my phone didn't died while sleeping. It did not charge at all. There was juice since radio and flashlight worked. If you want this for the radio and flashlight it's good, but dont count on the charging ports at all.
customer_reviews.author: P

customer_reviews.title: Only receive static! Poor Quality! Avoid!!
customer_reviews.text: Could not get anything except annoying static on any channel including weather band! This is main reason I purchased this radio! I have tried both hand crank and solar panel in sunlight. This is a very disappointing purchase! My husband said it is worthless junk and is headed for trash! Please explain what is wrong with your radio! Are all your radios like my non functioning? Please reply!! Please avoid this radio!! Look elsewhere for a quality weather radio! Seller does not respond!! AVOID!!
customer_reviews.author: hazel locale

customer_reviews.title: Great for emergencies or camping.
customer_reviews.text: Such a great deal. Flashlight works fine, hand cranking is easy, and solar charging convient. Did test the charger and was surprised. After sitting in windowsill for one day to solar charge I plugged in my phone that night at 30% and it charged it completely. I suspect the efficiency goes down if your using the radio at the same time. The radio sound quality isnt great but definitely more than legible for emergencies. Don't expect a premium bluetooth speaker sound for music. Flashlight is bright enough but don't expect a torch. Overall it does everything it claims well, at a good price and very lightweight compact design which is why I think the 5 stars is earned.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Mysteriously broke in less than a month
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item and put it in my bugout bag. I keep my back in the bed of my truck, but the the bed has a cover over it to keep water out. When I first got it, I charged it and it worked effortlessly. But I put it in my truck and took it out about 3 weeks later to show my buddy and it would turn on. The flash light wouldn't work either. It wouldn't charge using the charger or the crank. I know it didn't get wet so I don't know what went wrong with it but it is useless now.
customer_reviews.author: Korbin Havins

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price!
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome product for the price. Picks up all channels very crisp with antenna. The solar power works just fine, and can help charge phone. Also, crank works better than past radios I've used with crank. It just feels sturdy and durable. The battery life I can't fully give testimony to because I've only had it 6-7 months, but it is still going. Highly recommend, especially for the price. Gets the job done, and the solar element brings more variables for other events not foreseen.
customer_reviews.author: SMO

customer_reviews.title: Still Problematic
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this weather radio On November 6, 2018. I wrote a review stating the weather frequency did not work but otherwise the other functions were okay. The manufacturer stated that I would get a replacement but it was never received. Therefore, I remain dissatisfied with the so-called weather radio and disappointed that the manufacturer did not live up to the agreement to replace the item. Sorry, my recommendation remains: this is a NO-BUY item for me.
customer_reviews.author: TheGoodDoctor

customer_reviews.title: Great buy for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This little thing was brilliant. The power went out the day after it arrived so I got to check it out in a crisis. The radio doesn’t get ten best reception but we are living in the boon docks. Everything else was just as shown and we were really thankful that we had it. I charged my dead phone from it and then it recharged itself just sitting in the window sill. The flash light was quite bright and the hand crank was not too difficult to work. We also listed to the weather radio but the computerized voice was annoying after a while lol. I would definitely recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: Timely Arrival: I just got this last night, took it to school this morning only to find that the power was out, but school was still in session. I had light, I could listen to the radio and learn that school was not going to be canceled, and had the power outage continued, I could have charged my phone or other devices (I haven't actually tried that part yet). Other teachers were impressed and wanted one for their own. The result: I will be getting another one so that I can keep one at school and one for home.
customer_reviews.author: Betty A. Wright

customer_reviews.title: Great device.
customer_reviews.text: I have not used it much yet, but a bit of field testing out of the box, and it works exactly as they say it will. Seems pretty high quality to me, I have a few of them now, and I like to give them as gifts. I actually have it lashed to my mountain bike handlebars, and use it as a solar charger to keep my iphone charged on long rides! So far, this works fine, though I must concede that it kinda makes a Red Green show duct tape situation look pretty classy :)
customer_reviews.author: A reader

customer_reviews.title: Does the job it's intended to do, but cheaply made.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for emergencies and I expect it to do what it's supposed to do. After taking it out of the box and setting it up, I made sure everything functioned as expected. It did. However, fine-tuning to a specific station is rather impossible. The volume is not very loud, but gets the job done. It would be nice to be louder since some people will probably be using this in loud situations. The light works, but could be brighter. For the price, it's a decent buy.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Peterson

customer_reviews.title: I like it alot
customer_reviews.text: Only reason not a 5 . . . I didn't like the volume and tuning knobs. I know being small and compact the knobs had to be too. Other than that . . .it's exceptional! AM, FM and WX all come in quite well with good volume. Light is blinding. Have tried all 3 ways of charging and found no trouble. Even with the knobs . . . would buy again . . . and probably will.
customer_reviews.author: Russ KG0BK

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this at the last minute for hurricane Irma and boy were we surprised how useful it was! I charged it before heading out to a hurricane party and forgot all about it. What we didn't expect was that when we lost power, the cell towers would go down too. This radio was our only connection to the world during the storm and for the 15 hours after where we still didn't have power. It lasted at least 12 hours on a single charge with a few hand cranks every now and then just in case. This is a permanent addition to my hurricane kit!
customer_reviews.author: D. Felty

customer_reviews.title: POWERFUL CUTE/SMALL EMERGENCY CRANK RADIO
customer_reviews.text: Have had small radios before . Dissapointing sound volume. Unable to get 2 stations. For being so compact, this is a powerful radio. Having many channels that are clear Loud sounds. You get very good reception. Thats was important to me. Will help entertain n be informative during emergencies or anytime I want to take it to the beach, countryside or out to the porch and kichen. Handy and a great buy. Reliable and economical for such a sound reaching compact radio. ♡ it
customer_reviews.author: Blanqua

customer_reviews.title: Good radio for this price range
customer_reviews.text: A lot to like about this radio. It picks up AM, FM, and weather band stations. You can recharge using handcrank, USB cable, or solar panel. Battery life is good too - played it for several hours while I was working today. Only one complaint - the receiver dial is a little off. For future models, the manufacturer should consider switching to a digital display.
customer_reviews.author: John Wrynn

customer_reviews.title: Emergency radio/flashlight
customer_reviews.text: I got two of these for emergencies. They charge pretty well if left in a bright window and very well from the USB port on my computer. I have not tried to charge one via the hand crank. The radio reception is OK-mediocre for AM. You have to rotate the radio to find the better reception and the sound tends to be somewhat static-y. There is an indicator bulb to let you know you've got the station. The flashlight would be OK for walking a dark pathway or to find something. Overall, for the price, I think it is a good deal and worthwhile having about the house. The bright color makes it fairly easy to spot, too.
customer_reviews.author: M. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Grandmother loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My grandmother loves it. She has an old house and whenever there are storms, she loses electricity. She used to have to buy a lot of candles for those occasions. I bought her this years ago and she absolutely loves it. She uses the flashlight and the radio. Now when there ate storms, she always has this and is kept safe by the light and entertained by the radio until power comes back on (which takes a while usually). This is the second one I've bought for her. First one lasted like 2 years with pretty frequent use.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriela Gominho

customer_reviews.title: I'm not a prepper but I prefer being prepared
customer_reviews.text: Being a dad and prefer to be prepared. U dont realize u need one till it's to late. We have been having a lot of strong storms and the power goes out quite often, this has been there more than you'd think
customer_reviews.author: Rafael

customer_reviews.title: Great radio, not bad light, manual charging options...meh
customer_reviews.text: The reception on the radio is very good and the light is bright but don't expect it to flood a room or wide open area. I've had issues with the battery taking a charge. Using the hand crank will likely take a while to get to a decent charge, I haven't tried the solar panel but based on their size I would not count on it. Using the USB charger works well so I hook it up every other month to top off the charge.
customer_reviews.author: WanderLust

customer_reviews.title: Radio reception is excellent as is the audio
customer_reviews.text: I’m a wilderness educator and I’ve been considering adding a hand crank radio to my pack for some time. I considered Midland and the Red Cross radios before deciding to give this one a chance. This radio is compact, relatively light and works very well. Radio reception is excellent as is the audio. Worth the money, and as good as its more expensive counterparts.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: versatile and useful emergency device
customer_reviews.text: great little device: flashlight, radio (with weather band as well as AM/FM), and phone charger all in one, plus charges 3 ways: hand crank, solar, or USB port. that means you've got a bunch of things you need in a blackout or emergency in one small water-resistant package - or just to listen to radio while in the tub. best of all, keep it on your windowsill and battery will always be charged up when you need it, thanks to the solar panel. so happy with this that i immediately ordered a second one.
customer_reviews.author: davismaximus

customer_reviews.title: Compact, works great.
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than I imagined it would be. Which is good. I pulled it out of the package, turned on the radio and was surprised that it was able to get several stations. I live in an agricultural area with limited radio choices, so I was pleased that I was able to get anything at all. All in all, a great little radio-charger-flashlight to set aside for emergencies.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Big sound, well made
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this radio as a gift, and I was pleasantly surprised at the quality for the price. It feels solidly made. I checked it out before giving it away just to make sure it worked, and I was impressed with the sound quality for such a small radio. I haven't used it's charging features yet, so I can't comment on how well that works. It came with a USB connector for charging phones. It contains an led light as well. I was quite impressed with the unit and wouldn't hesitate to recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Jade Lazlow

customer_reviews.title: Great radio and it really charges an i-phone as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: Good, inexpensive radio. Charges my i-phone surprisingly well. As a former humanitarian assistance/disaster plans consultant, I take these "just in case" products that I purchase for myself very seriously and give them a thorough examination. This little radio has all the necessary bells and whistles for very little money, and most importantly, it actually works. As an aside, I had an issue with a radio, discussed it with Esky customer service, and they fixed things nearly immediately. I am actually extremely impressed with the little Esky radio as well as the company behind it and it'll go on my recommended list for my friends interested in disaster preparation.
customer_reviews.author: jeff e.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent emergency radio/flashlight
customer_reviews.text: This is great to have in case of an emergency, or just to take camping. It can be charged via the hand crank, solar panel, or simply by plugging it in. The radio has great reception for picking up those emergency broadcast channels and the led flashlight lasts for hours on a charge. Everyone should have one of these in there emergency kit.
customer_reviews.author: Tech Junkie

customer_reviews.title: Can't get the WB channel to receive a signal
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about it except what I actually bought it for. With hurricane Florence bearing down on my state in the next few days, I ordered this to have a NOAA weather radio. The am/fm channels receive signal just fine but when I switch to wb channel I get nothing but static. Searched online for answers but so far haven't found any. I thought NOAA broadcast continually so I should have been able to receive a signal. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Littleton

customer_reviews.title: Radio did not work! But I got a replacement
customer_reviews.text: This product was okay, but after charging the radio never worked. That was the main reason in buying this product. The LED light did work, but other than that it was not that good of a product. After this review, I received a new one in the mail. I'm glad they sent me a new. This one work and everything. Although it would have been nice to actually use it when we actually needed. The company has also contacted me via email on my response to the new item.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous1

customer_reviews.title: Its tiny! Very cute but crank doesn't deliver much power - mainly only useful to charge the light. Antenna snapped off easily.
customer_reviews.text: its okay, I bought it as a backup, but beware - this is much much smaller than it looks - like fits in the palm of your hand! I am pretty sure its novelty item really - the radio and light works but i seriously doubt the ability for the crank to deliver much power. will update once tested. Updated: played with this the other day, it take a *LOT* of cranking to charge a phone, like to the effect of probably better spending your energy hunting for a new phone somewhere. Also the antenna snapped off when I was simply adjusting it for signal - very very flimsy, i wasn't being rough at all.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Have a real person try out this gadgets. It looks good on your photos.
customer_reviews.text: Junkie is the word that comes to mind. Also, I have no way to verify if it is actually working. If I plug it into my phone, and crank, I would expect some movement- none. Oh, the adapter was wrong. Apple updated their power plug several years ago and you are still shipping the old plug. I was hoping for more.
customer_reviews.author: Robert D. Young

customer_reviews.title: Too good to be TRUE?
customer_reviews.text: YES! It is too good to be true. The small, inexpensive unit was supposed to also charge an iPhone. It does not. Crank however much you want. The light works well enough, and there is a mediocre radio, but -- though I cranked more than was needed -- the radio soon kept turning itself off. I say: if you need a GOOD, RELIABLE solar-power (havent tried that yet, in cloudy snow weather), hand-cranked, then buy something other! This I will put away as a useless purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Lapeyrouse

customer_reviews.title: I Got a Dud!
customer_reviews.text: I got a bad one or something. Even in a metro city I cannot pick up one FM AM or Weather band station. At this point it is nothing but a weak flashlight with a hand crank. Took it camping and it was a waste when you have an Emergency Weather Radio that doesn't work since day 1. Sadly I got this 2 weeks before I went camping and we were gone on vacation for 2 weeks so It was too late to return it when I got back
customer_reviews.author: Wes

customer_reviews.title: I like this crank radio
customer_reviews.text: I like this crank radio, light, charger. The one thing I am not thrilled with (though it's certainly not a horrible thing) is the noise generated by the crank.I probably should have expected this though, given that it IS manual (d'oh). The solar charging is very slow too, but then again, it isn't as if this is designed to be a rapidly charged device in the first place. Besides, it also has an AC charger to keep it at the ready.
customer_reviews.author: Rik

customer_reviews.title: Great value and useful during power outages.
customer_reviews.text: We were just without power and the internet for several days. I bought this radio so I can listen to the weather, charge my phone, and not worry about a power source. The radio is small and barely weighs anything. It can be wore on your wrist, or slipped into a pocket or bag. The flashlight is a nice thing to have also. It is very easy to use the crank. I just wish I had it for the derecho.
customer_reviews.author: K. A. Cohlmia

customer_reviews.title: Great for your emergency kit
customer_reviews.text: Bought a couple of these to replace an older Oregon Scientific model. These are great! Slightly smaller footprint, hand crank is smooth and comfortable to use, flashlight is bright, and radio sound quality is excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Lane

customer_reviews.title: Radio works, the cranking works. And the solar panel as well.
customer_reviews.text: We tested it. And it works just like described. The radio works, the cranking works. And the solar panel as well. But we just tested it on purchase. I will update up and down when we test it again in 9 months.
customer_reviews.author: JoannaG

customer_reviews.title: I have been very pleased with the unit so far
customer_reviews.text: I replaced an old that I have had for over 20 years with this unit. I have been very pleased with the unit so far. This unit has much better reception than my old unit. I have used the wind up crank for charging the battery which does work, however I have found that if you leave the unit where it can get some sun, you never have to charge the unit. The unit also works to power other devices which is a nice addition
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, works well
customer_reviews.text: Great product to have for emergencies, works better than expected. I think its great for the price to have on hand. It doesnt last long, for the amount of cranking required, however this is on par with other crank radios I've used.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Small but JOB WELL DONE
customer_reviews.text: Love the size and the great flashlight The battery life is really impressive It is smaller than expected but it does the job We are in the hottest hurricane path in the states and electricity can go out in a bad storm Perhaps my rural area has something to do with the sound quality and ability to pick up a station
customer_reviews.author: sam termine

customer_reviews.title: I really liked this radio/flashlight / solar power/ hand cranked device
customer_reviews.text: This little device is awesome. I baught one for my man's hunting trips, and I liked it so much I baught another to keep in the house for when the power goes out. The flash light is very powerful and last 2-3hrs without charging. The radio is ok, but really that is only a plus cause we only need it for emergencies. The USB can and does charge your phone. We both have smart phones, and it does take several hours to recharge your phone, but it works. I feel like this is a wonderful device and I would buy again for a friend or family member.
customer_reviews.author: Petra Warnick

customer_reviews.title: Great Radio I recommend it.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this radio for weather emergencies. It really works. Have not had the emergency yet, but when we do we will be ready. Cell towers go down in severe weather, radio waves however still get through. It is really well worth the money, and I see no reason to spend any more money on different brands when this one works perfectly fine and is sold at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Alright but finnicky
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Flashlight does the job indoors if the power goes out. Its easy to charge and the handle stores flat. Holds a charge for months no problem. Cons: The dial is extremely finnicky to set the station and is a bit annoying. While it can get decently loud the sounds is very "tinny". Its not an audio speaker but it definitely didnt have to be that cheap of an audio quality considering the price.
customer_reviews.author: Customer McCustomerface

customer_reviews.title: Read the directions 1st
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for use in emergency situations. I tried to plug it in and charge it before I read the directions. Which is u have to crank it for 5 min or fully charge via sun panels. I was anxious to use it so I tried the 5mins....ugh. It didnt work. I gave up and handed it off to my hubby who gave it to my son after trying for 5 min. Bottom line. I left it in direct sunlight with the intent to try it at a later time. This afternoon....I finally tuned into a station.
customer_reviews.author: QueenReen

customer_reviews.title: ESky Radio a great value
customer_reviews.text: Good reception, strong speaker Easy on/off I like this little radio better than ETON which I also use. I live in New York City and don’t have a TV, this great little radio is my lifeline to the world, I listen to the BBC each night, it comes on at midnight on WNYC, the public broadcast station That the same station that carries NPR during the daytime hours, I don’t listen in daytime as NPR far too liberal, Buy a eSky red radio and it will change your life, best $20 ever spent! Easy recharge like an iphone
customer_reviews.author: Paul Morris

customer_reviews.title: Small, lightweight, low price, good reception
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic price on a tiny lightweight go-bag perfect emergency radio. My house is a large grounding antenna, and I had no trouble getting reception. To the people complaining that their devices discharge faster than this will charge them, it's an Emergency Charging Device with a small battery - turn your device off and give it a chance to charge. Would like it to have a headphone jack, but otherwise it's great for what it is designed to be!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Scullin

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BE LURED INTO A FALSE SENSE OF SECURITY.
customer_reviews.text: Living in Florida, I bought this for my hurricane emergency supply kit in 2017. Luckily I didn't need it until the 2019 season when Dorian was coming. I took it out of the box to charge and it would not hold a charge which is simply inexcusable for a piece of emergency equipment. When I contacted the company they told me I was outside the 12 month warranty window even though it was brand new out of the box. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: fantastic.
customer_reviews.text: this is the best product ever! I was able to charge my phone on it and it is not a smart phone so glad its solar powerd and the flash light is better and brighter then my tactacle flash light also great sounding radio and the whether warning broadcast is great! so for the price this radio could be a life saver .plus the saveings on having to buy new battery's .because o the solar powerd battery is .this radio is a must have!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Radio sure works good and the sound is not bad at all
customer_reviews.text: Not sure about the cranking power. We cranked and cranked and cranked and the red light never went out. Finally gave up and charged up the box with the USB connected to laptop port. Radio sure works good and the sound is not bad at all. We've had several bigger radios like those used on night stands, etc. that did not sound as good as this guy. Even the weather frequency was picked up and came through loud and clear. Definitely recommend to anyone that needs an emergency radio. Set it in the sun for charging as well.
customer_reviews.author: tumbleweed

customer_reviews.title: Everyone needs this emergency radio
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this little guy for our emergency 'go bag'. My husband laughed at me when it arrived because it was so small. After 5 min. of playing with it, he loved it and told me to order a couple more for our cars. I highly recommend this radio. It is a great purchase...and I love the yellow color too.
customer_reviews.author: Laquita Parks-Lewis

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING FOR CAMPING AND HIKING!!!
customer_reviews.text: This radio is great! its small and compact and the charge lasts forever it seems! I had it blasting all day today in my pocket while I was hiking, never had to crank it once! The only negative thing I could possibly say about it is the lack of headphone jack which super sucks and that the volume dial is really touchy but otherwise its a life saving device if your bored on the trail! Way worth the 20 bucks. Im so glad I bought this
customer_reviews.author: orion riedel

customer_reviews.title: SOLAR CHARGING DOES NOT WORK!
customer_reviews.text: NEVER charged, via solar, to full capacity. WILL NOT charge your cell phone or tablet. The solar and recharging components of this device did not function as advertised. We tried to charge it, several times, all day, in bright sun. We are basically stuck with a pocket-sized, overpriced battery/crank transistor radio.
customer_reviews.author: Dinandrea

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I gave it 5 stars all the way around but I am really not sure as far as the battery is concerned. We have not used but it perfect for emergency. I have purchased for all our sons you just never know all you have to do is crank it if electricity goes out and if there is no sun for the solar part .
customer_reviews.author: D Collins

customer_reviews.title: Good company; good radio
customer_reviews.text: Initially the battery didn't hold for very long; I was ready to chalk it up to being a lemon. The company contacted me about the radio, sent me a replacement, and so far, no problems. This is a case of the company being above board and good customer service. I was pleased with the volume produced by such a small radio! One year later: We put the radio outside in the sun, and it played all afternoon the first day of use. After charging in the sun the next day, it played a few minutes. Now it plays if cranked but the solar charger isn't working. Sound is good if hand cranked, so that's what we do!
customer_reviews.author: emma

customer_reviews.title: Cute and useful
customer_reviews.text: I love this. It very compact as you can see from the photos. I’m a woman with average size hands. The radio sound is clear and relatively loud. I gave a full charge it is still charged couple of months later. The flashlight is not super bright but enough. The hand crank works. I tried it with my phone. I have not tried the solar power yet.
customer_reviews.author: JASMINE

customer_reviews.title: It's not the top of the line but - hey, it does the job.
customer_reviews.text: Ya Know... for the price, this is exactly okay. On the day after I received this unit the power went out at my house. I was at work and my Mrs. said the battery on her cell-phone was low. Heck, if I was there, that would not of been a problem. Sometimes real-life hits you and you say -> I wish I had (...something...). This may not be the absolutely best, but, those do cost more. I'm just happy with this. Gotta get one for the house.
customer_reviews.author: Charles A. Bass

customer_reviews.title: Very good to have during storms
customer_reviews.text: Out of the package it looks like a toy. Almost like one of those old Hasbro Transformer robots. But the truth is it works very well - you may need to hand crank it for a few minutes to keep the power going for a long time during an electric outage, but it's worth it. It was handy when I lost power for a few days during Tropical Storm Isaias - I could hear news and information about what was happening in the outside world. The fact that it has a flashlight on the side is good. I haven't tried out the cell phone recharger. But it's probably something good to have.
customer_reviews.author: Shaw Izikson

customer_reviews.title: Teeny tiny
customer_reviews.text: I should have paid more attention to the photos and descriptions. I thought this was a large sized flashlight and radio. It is tiny... the size of a cell phone as the one picture shows. If that's what you are doing for, it looks like it works well. I can't speak to durability or battery life yet.
customer_reviews.author: Panda

customer_reviews.title: Great Radio, flashlight is fine. Won't charge anything though.
customer_reviews.text: The radio is tinny but fine. The light is ok in a pinch. However do not expect this device to recharge anything. Bike lights or iphones- it starts out fine but cuts off charging after 30 seconds or so.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Works for emergency kit
customer_reviews.text: I got this radio in advance of a hurricane a couple of years ago and it works well enough for that. My radio didn't have a full usb port on it in order to charge other devices, but I wasn't really looking for one that did. I wanted a weather radio with a crank and this fits the bill.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Chicklet

customer_reviews.title: A little Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: They sent me a bright Yellow color one Photo shows Red color that is what I wanted and order. It does not include an AC connection it is smaller then what I was expecting. The rubber flap on the side that protects the charging inlet fall right off after just three days. The radio seems to work well.I would not buy again. I did not received this product free for review and evaluation purposes
customer_reviews.author: THESTEVEO

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt charge phone but still a good utility
customer_reviews.text: If your looking for something that plays radio has a flashlight and charges with crank or solar then this product will work for you BUT!!!! If you are gonna try to use it to charge your phone dont bother i have a s7 edge it doesnt charge at all my battery was still dying hooked up also tried a s6 and s5 both doesnt charge just holds the battery as is
customer_reviews.author: jeremiah

customer_reviews.title: but the hand crank works fine and when I fully charged it (plugging it in) ...
customer_reviews.text: Definitely worth the money. I haven't tried the solar charging yet, but the hand crank works fine and when I fully charged it (plugging it in) I was able to charge my phone from 8% to 29%. It may have done more but I just wanted to check that it would work in an emergency. The radio picks up everything as well, and is super clear. I'm keeping mine in my car and will be buying one for my mom and sister as well. Good for big out bags and other emergency prep kits.
customer_reviews.author: Jules303

customer_reviews.title: Great sound quality - how I never need to use this radio
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my Flee Bag as we live in wildfire country. It cranks easily and I was able to listen to radio stations quite clearly with this little guy. The radio is surprisingly quite small, which is perfect for a go bag. I charged it both from the crank and from a solar charged power bank. Now cross this item off the list and hope I never need to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie C

customer_reviews.title: Small but great
customer_reviews.text: I love this little lifesaving, flashlight, hand-crank genius of a weather radio! I have had a weather radio always (mom insisted and she is always right) and this one is perfect. Small but fits a lot of needs. Plus the hand crank is easy and works well. Definitely worth the money for my family emergency kit.
customer_reviews.author: smileyface_girl

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for an emergency kit
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item to finish my emergency kit. I live on an island and bad weather is always a concern. Since this items has both a crank and solar options for power it was ideal. If the power goes out I don't have to worry how long batteries might last. It can be used for light and to get radio reports when I need them. It is small so I can store and carry it with ease. I am very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: BenBen

customer_reviews.title: Worked amazing during hurricane Irma
customer_reviews.text: This radio was great during hurricane Irma and post hurricane when we lost power for 5 days. Not only could u hear emergency broadcast but also radio as well. Light comes in handy in a pinch. If you run out of power just crank it for a few minutes and it will get you reasonable listening time.
customer_reviews.author: D. Lajavrac

customer_reviews.title: Company attentive to customers
customer_reviews.text: When I wasn't happy with my purchase, Thousandshores emailed and sent me another Esky rechargeable radio, also suggested to crank the arm to start the initial charge. I do want my review to reflect their concern that they help and respond quickly to customers who buy their products.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonExplorer

customer_reviews.title: Not again
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately we didn't try it until we needed it. The light worked fine. The radio not at all. We bought it last year 2018 in Dec and tried to use it this year 2019 in Oct. Lesson- try the radio immediately- all functions so it's not way out of warranty before you discover it doesn't work at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cool little emergency radio charger
customer_reviews.text: Cool little emergency radio charger. I bought this product just to keep in my home in case of an emergency. Plugged it in and charged this item works great and for a good amount of time on a single charge. Hand crank is comfortable and sturdy and works great. Haven't tried to solar panel charger tomits full potential but does take quite some time to charge up but the solar portion to me is just an extra plus because I don't mind cranking to charge. If you are looking for a small radio charger in case of emergency this item is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent addition to any emergency kit
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend this for any emergency kit/bug out bag or even just to throw one in each of your vehicles. You can get radio, emergency & weather info plus charge your phone with either solar power or hand crank. For the money, this is a no brainer to have on hand just in case of emergency.
customer_reviews.author: trytych

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to keep on top of the weather
customer_reviews.text: We use this just about every night to listen to weather radio. I've also used the light several times. As far as the regular radio stations go it's got your basic transistor radio reception, but we could always get weather radio. I've used all three charging methods to make sure they work, and they certainly do. It's a great little addition that doesn't take up much room at all.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Decker

customer_reviews.title: GREAT SERVICE!!!
customer_reviews.text: I order 2 radios to use on vacation. 1 worked perfectly fine, but the other not at all The company replaced the broken radio. Thanks so much!
customer_reviews.author: TiffNi

customer_reviews.title: So I bought this thinking I was being stupid for spending money on something unnecessary
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this thinking I was being stupid for spending money on something unnecessary, but I'm actually really pleased with this device! I haven't needed it for an emergency, but I took it camping. The flashlight is nice and bright, and we also used it as a radio/phone charger! I wish it had an indicator to tell you how much battery you have, but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: sarah

customer_reviews.title: Thank you Amazon.
customer_reviews.text: Another great product available in Amazon. Last night We had bad weather, hail and a funnel passing our home. The radio was clearly giving weather updates. The flashlight worked on for 7 hours. The only minus I didn't know was how to charge my Android phone with it, but it is a great tool for emergencies.
customer_reviews.author: classic lady

customer_reviews.title: This little thing is awesome!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This little thing is awesome!!!!!! The Customer Service of the seller is Top Notch! I received a non functional unit and they replaced it with a working one right away and without question. The second unit works perfectly. This thing is small and functional. I will get one more for a backup. Light, radio, phone charger with a solar panel and a hand crank. Perfect for what it is!
customer_reviews.author: CP

customer_reviews.title: Great for Emergencies
customer_reviews.text: Very bright LED light. Fairly compact and like how you can charge it via A/C plug, crank or solar. Will charge your cell phone via micro USB port. Bought one for daughter for college and one for home. Does everything as advertised. Great for home, car, travel. Don't have to worry about ever being stranded without phone power.
customer_reviews.author: D. Scampini

customer_reviews.title: Battery life stinks
customer_reviews.text: Four and one-half months after purchasing this item, it's going into the garbage heap. The solar charging function barely works, cranking (100 revolutions) yields about 45 seconds of weather radio. It has been little used, as I bought it as back-up in case of power loss in severe weather. We've been spared severe weather where I live since I purchased it. Thank goodness, because trying to depend on this would be futile... unless someone were ready to crank it full time just to hear the weather reports.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph H. Monast
